page.title: 01Kirkton-of Rayne countryside
page.content: It is a sparsely populated area, containing 3 small villages, each with a disused grain mill and linked by streams. The landscape is undulating,agricultural land with small farms and patches of coniferous woodland. Farming is traditional, with a mixture of cereals and animals. Wildlife is rich and varied (e.g. roe deer, hores, bats). The nearest Doctor, secondary school and shops are in Insch or Inverurie (each 7 miles from Wartle). A mobile library, fish and grocery vans come to the villaes and a school bus collects the children daily. The railway line is now derelict. The church of Rayne and the Bank Inn are the only places for residents to meet. They are mostly farmers
